title: 'Cheers!' Series: Passengers by The 7 Fingers (Canada)
progtime: The running time of the performance is approximately 1 hour 30 minutes without intermission. Latecomers will only be admitted at a suitable break.
desc: The production takes train travel as the story background, a series of vignettes tells the unique stories of fateful encounters inside the cabin, a community of strangers with one thing in common: they all have somewhere to go. Passengers on this train express their dreams through the exuberance of their bodies. The astounding skills like the silks, flying trapeze, tightrope walking, juggling and hula hoops demonstrate the physical artistry and beauty of the performers. Passengers seamlessly combines dance, theatre, acrobatics, music and projections, celebrating the balance and the beauty of interpersonal relationships. Intertwining the railroad and human experience where we transition from farewells, new beginnings to reminiscences.
remark:
The programme does not represent the views of the Leisure and Cultural Services Department. The presenter reserves the right to change the programme and substitute artists.

Acrobatic performers have been professionally trained to accomplish the feats performed. Audience is advised not to imitate their acts.

title: "ADifficult Year"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Albert and Bruno are compulsive consumers, over-indebted, they live between small schemes for one and a personal life adrift for the other. It’s in the community work they’re both doing to pull themselves up by their bootstraps that they come across a group of young activists who are revolted by climate change, social justice and eco-responsibility…
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "AbbéPierre – A Century of Devotion"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Born and raised a catholic, Henri Grouès is determined to become a priest. WWII begins and decides otherwise: he joins the Resistance. Losing a friend on the battlefield, facing the horrors of war, Henri Grouès emerges as a new man: L’Abbé Pierre. L’Abbé Pierre will fight for the homeless and give a voice to the speechless. A humanist, he met everyone in needs. His dedication earned him the respect of his peers and a place in every hearts. His impact earned him a place in History.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "BBC Seven Worlds One Planet" Live in Concert
presenterorg: Presented by The Hong Kong Philharmonic Orchestra

title: "Don'tLook Now: We're Being Shot At"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Summer 1941. Over Nazi-occupied France, a Royal Air Force B17 Flying Fortress becomes lost after a mission and is shot down over Paris by German flak. The crew parachutes out over the city, where they run into and are hidden by a house painter and the grumbling conductor of the Opéra National de Paris. Involuntarily, they get themselves tangled up in the manhunt against the aviators as they help the airmen to escape to the free zone with the help of Resistance fighters and sympathisers.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "Elaha" - German Film Forum: Generation Z
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: A naked young woman is standing in front of a running washing machine. Flashback. 22-year-old Elaha tries all that she can to recover a supposed “innocence” that she has lost through sex. A plastic surgeon is set to help her. But she cannot come up with the money for the costly procedure. While looking for an alternative, she comes across a special product – a capsule of artificial blood. But what at first seems to be a solution to her problem ultimately forces her into self-exploitation.
remark: In German with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Goethe-Institut Hongkong

title: "Jeannedu Barry"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: In arural French village an old man and his only remaining relative cast theircovetous eyes on an adjoining vacant property. They need its spring water forgrowing their flowers, so are dismayed to hear the man who has inherited it ismoving in. They block up the spring and watch as their new neighbour tries tokeep his crops watered from wells far afield through the hot summer. Thoughthey see his desperate efforts are breaking his health and his wife anddaughter’s hearts they think only of getting the water.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "Jeannedu Barry"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Jeanne, a young working-class woman hungry for culture and pleasure, uses her intelligence and allure to climb the rungs of the social ladder one by one. She becomes the favourite of King Louis XV who, unaware of her status as courtesan, regains through her his appetite for life. They fall madly in love. Against all propriety and etiquette, Jeanne moves to Versailles, where her arrival scandalizes the court...
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "Manonof the Spring"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: After the death of Jean Cadoret, his wife has returned to the life of opera singer and his daughter Manon has grown up and become a gorgeous lonely shepherdess. Ugolin is now a thirty year-old wealthy bachelor planting carnations. His grandfather Cesar Soubeyran presses him to get married to carry the name of their family since he is the last man alive. When Ugolin sees Manon on the fields, he falls in love with her. One day, Manon plots revenge against Ugolin and Cesar and the whole town is in despair.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "My Son" - German Film Forum: Generation Z
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Her daredevil son Jason's serious accident is a turning point in the life of photographer Marlene. When it becomes clear how severe Jason's injuries are, only a special rehab in Switzerland can help. Marlene decides to drive her son herself all the way from Berlin across Germany. Mother and son struggle for closeness and distance, disappointing their respective expectations and inevitably ending up in old conflicts. Something from the past is making its way to the surface, and it takes up more space with every kilometer they drive.
remark: In German with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Goethe-Institut Hongkong

title: "Nö" - German Film Forum: Generation Z
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Dina and Michael are in their early thirties. He is a doctor, she is an actress. They are happy together until Michael thinks about breaking up. She says: NOPE (NÖ). In thirteen episodes, we then accompany our two heroes while they maneuver through life over the years and try to not lose sight of their love. "NÖ" is a film about love, how to find love and our struggles to live with love. It's a film about a generation in their thirties, who have everything, who have tried everything but who often still fail silently. The film exposes hidden states of mind and at the same time shows the important impact they have on our lives.
remark: In German with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Goethe-Institut Hongkong

title: "One in a Million" - German Film Forum: Generation Z
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: "One in a Million" tells the story of two girls coming of age. As gymnast and YouTuber Whitney Bjerken from the US struggles with setbacks, she turns to music to express her feelings. Yara from Germany is one of her biggest fans and and part of a show-acrobatics team. When she falls in love with a girl for the very first time, she barely finds time for her fan account anymore. A documentary coming-of-age film about success and loneliness, friendship and first love, coming out as queer and having the courage to find your voice.
remark: In German with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Goethe-Institut Hongkong

title: "RobotDreams"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Based on a graphic novel by Sara Varon, Goya-Award-winning director Pablo Berger’s first venture into animation is a colourful, vibrant and touching buddy drama. To escape solitude, Dog assembles Robot from a build-it-yourself kit. Setting off on a whimsical exploration of New York City, the new best friends develop an inseparable bond as they savour curbside hotdogs and roller-skate through Central Park. However, their friendship is abruptly brought to a halt when an accident leaves Robot stranded on a beach.
remark: No Dialogue
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "Suddenly"-The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Ben and Laura sail around the world. Arriving off the coast of Antarctica, they take a diversion to explore an island. But once there, their boat disappears in a storm. Suddenly alone, exposed to cold, hunger, fear and the raging elements, Ben and Laura will have to go to the limit of their ability to survive – and the truth about their relationship.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "Talking About the Weather" - German Film Forum: Generation Z
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Clara is taking a PhD in philosophy. Between her professional ambitions and an affair with one of her students she had little time for family. When Clara visits her home in provincial Mecklenburg-Vorpommern for her mother’s birthday, she finds herself struggling with the pride and expectations but also with the rejection of her family and former companions. She begins to realise just how far she has moved away from her roots in her search for a self-determined life and the price she must pay for it.
remark: In German with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Goethe-Institut Hongkong

title: "Taxi"-The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Daniel used to deliver pizzas. Now he’s a taxi driver. He’s a demon at the wheel and drives a very powerful car. He is forced into making a deal with the police when he has a run-in with Emilien, a cop who’s just failed his driving test for the eighth time. If Daniel wants to hold on to his license, he has to help break up a gang of fast-driving German bank robbers who are plundering the city’s banks.ves Robot stranded on a beach.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "TheBlack Pharaoh, the Savage and the Princes"- The 52nd Hong Kong French FilmFestival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: Threetales, three ages, three worlds. At the time of Ancient Egypt, a young kingbecomes the first black pharaoh to deserve the hand of his loved one. Duringthe French Middle Ages, a mysterious wild boy steals from the rich to give tothe poor. In the 18th century Turkey, a prince of pastries and a princess ofroses escape the palace to live their love.
remark: In French with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: "TheThree Musketeers: D'artagnan"- The 52nd Hong Kong French Film Festival
agelimit: For person aged 6 or above only
desc: D’Artagnanis left for dead after trying to save a young woman from being kidnapped. Whenhe arrives in Paris, he tries by all means to find his attackers. He is unawarethat his quest will lead him at the heart of a real war where the future ofFrance is at stake. Allied with Athos, Porthos and Aramis, three musketeers ofthe King with a dangerous temerity, D’Artagnan faces the dark machinations ofthe Cardinal of Richelieu…
remark: In French and in English with English subtitles
presenterorg: Presented by Alliance Française de Hong Kong

title: “Tan Dun WE-Festival”: Tan Dun: BACH Rock & Hanggai - When BACH meets GENGHIS KHAN
progtime: The performance will run for about 1 hour and 45 minutes including a 15-minute intermission.
desc: Together with renowned rock band Hanggai and the Changsha Symphony Orchestra, Tan Dun will take the works of Johann Sebastian Bach, dubbed "the father of classical music", as a medium for a dialogue with the Mongolian rock music along with digital animation and multimedia technology.  It will give audiences an exceptional auditory feast that connects East and West, past and future, as well as technology and nature ecology. The music pieces such as "The Rising Sun", " Invention - Four Seasons" and "Grassland My Beautiful Home" possesses an embodied connection to the landscapes of grassland, mountain and river that will deliver the message of protecting nature to the theatre-goers.  In addition, singer-songwriter Tan Weiwei will perform the work in a symphonic setting with rustic traditional oriental vocal style.
remark:

title: Bach im Theater: "St. John Passion": Pre-performance Talk
desc: Bach’s "St. John Passion" is a canonical work in the musical repertoire. SingFest director Patrick Chiu has made some significant adjustments in this production, such as accentuating the roles of Peter, Pontius Pilate and the chorus, as well as transposing vocal types. These changes may look unconventional and daring, but they result from years of research on the composer. Chiu shares his reasoning behind his ideas.

title: Beare’s Premiere Music Festival 2024 - A Romantic Interlude
progtime: The programme will run for about 100 minutes with one intermission.
desc: Indulge yourself in the profound emotion and expressiveness of chamber music from the Romantic period. The concert begins with the enchanting Schubert Fantasie, performed by the dynamic piano duo Orion Weiss and Shai Wosner.  This is followed by the captivating melodies of the Smetana Trio, featuring the dazzling violinist So-Ock Kim, cello powerhouse Gary Hoffman and the brilliant Orion Weiss.  The concert reaches its emotional pinnacle with the resplendent beauty of Brahms’ String Quintet, skillfully interpreted by the virtuosic ensemble led by star violinist Ning Feng.

title: Beare’s Premiere Music Festival 2024 - Festival Closing Gala︰A Night with Robin Tritschler
progtime: The programme will run for about 115 minutes with one intermission.
desc:
"Tritschler confirms his credentials as a natural in Lieder. His is a voice of spring, fresh and easy on the ear” 
Gramophone

“One of the most sensitive and musical of today’s younger Lieder interpreters” (The Telegraph) Robin Tritschler returns for our Festival Closing Gala.  The acclaimed Irish tenor will be performing two song cycles – first he partners with Shai Wosner in one of Schumann’s greatest vocal works Liederkreis; later the pair is joined by the Miró Quartet for the lesser-performed but equally remarkable On Wenlock Edge by Vaughan-Williams. 

In additional to these vocal masterpieces, the concert also showcases the dynamic duo of Orion Weiss and Shai Wosner in Beethoven’s Grosse Fuge.  And, for the grand finale of this year’s Beare’s Premiere Music Festival, our exceptional festival musicians come together for one of the most beloved works in the chamber music canon, Schumann’s exuberant Piano Quintet.

title: Beare’s Premiere Music Festival 2024 - Festival Opening Concert︰Spotlight on the Miró Quartet
progtime: The programme will run for about 105 minutes with one intermission.
desc:
The Miró dispatched [Shaw’s Microfictions] joyfully, leaning into the solemnity of the glorious chords, the pleasure of melodic expressions of sweetness and tongue-in-cheek sorrow.”
The Boston Musical Intelligencer

Our festival opens with a focus on the Miró Quartet, one of America’s most celebrated and dedicated string quartets, playing the Asian Premiere of star composer Caroline Shaw’s Microfictions. Caroline Shaw is a distinctive voice in American music, and has received a Pulitzer Prize in Music and several Grammy awards. This work, Microfictions, was co-commissioned by Premiere Performances (with the support of Interlude.hk), together with the La Jolla Music Society, Carnegie Hall, Chamber Music Houston and the Shriver Hall Concert Series, and was dedicated to the Miró Quartet themselves. The work is a stimulating set of six short musical stories in the tradition of imagist poetry and the surrealist painting of Joan Miró. 

This concert will also feature two beloved masterpieces for strings: the invigorating Mozart’s String Quintet in G minor (with violist Masumi Per Rostad) and the magnificent Brahms Quartet No. 1.

title: Beare’s Premiere Music Festival 2024 - Musical Fairy Tales: Peter and the Wolf
progtime: The programme will run for about 60 minutes without intermission.
desc:
Premiere Performances is proud to present the second instalment of Musical Fairy Tales as part of the 2024 Beare’s Premiere Music Festival! The centrepiece will be Prokofiev’s family classic Peter & the Wolf – a fascinating story about the two title characters and a crowd of animals – performed by our wind quintet Viva! Pipers. The concert will also feature The Three Little Pigs (in a clever arrangement of Beethoven’s 5th Symphony for a string quartet) as well as selections from Evelyn Chang’s Fantasies for Children Musical Stories (played by the composer herself). All fairytales will be narrated by actress Margaret Cheung. This concert is a great way for children to experience the descriptive ability of music and to spark their imaginations! 

Language
2:30pm performance: With narration in Cantonese
4:30pm performance: With narration in English

title: Beare’s Premiere Music Festival 2024 - The Genius of Mozart
progtime: The programme will run for about 110 minutes with one intermission.
desc:
[Ning Feng is] a wonderful player with a creamy, easy tone and an emotional honesty”
The Washington Post

Legendary conductor Karl Böhm once described Mozart as the “greatest of all musical geniuses”. Now, you have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the brilliance and grace of Mozart with some of his chamber music masterpieces.  Feel the joy and synchronicity between Orion Weiss and Shai Wosner as they perform the rousing Sonata for Two Pianos. Experience the luscious harmonies and stunning artistry of the renowned Miró Quartet as they play the “Dissonance” String Quartet.  And to close the concert, violin virtuoso Ning Feng join hands with violist Masumi Per Rostad and cellist Gary Hoffman in the charming “Divertimento” string trio.

title: Hong Kong Pop Culture Festival 2023 – Culture Café
predate: 20 May, 17 June, 22 July, 26 August, 23 September, 21 October, 25 November, 16 December 2023
progtime: The sharing session will run for about 1 hour
desc: Hosted by veteran music culturists Wong Chi-chung and Clarence Chang , the sharing sessions will focus on five topics, exploring different aspects and changes of Hong Kong's pop music culture from multiple perspectives. Selected music demos will be played through vinyl turntable, letting the participants appreciate the details and tunes of music from different periods, and evoke different memories through the great classics. Musicians from different generations and styles will be invited to join some of the sessions.

title: Musicus Fest 2023—Festival Finale: Camerata Salzburg
progtime: The performance will run for about 1 hour and 30 minutes, including a 20-minute intermission.
desc:
ViolinSolo: Fan Hiu-sing & Jeremy Hao	Camerata Salzburg	
	Hailingfrom the great composer’s hometown, Camerata Salzburg is the resident orchestraof the city’s annual Mozarteum Festival and has performed in prestigious venuesaround the world, including in the Lucerne Festival, BBC Proms, EdinburghInternational Festival and Carnegie Hall in New York.	
	The purveyors of the “Mozart sound” willgive audiences a special treat at the Festival Finale, presenting Mozart’slesser-performed Concertone for Two Violins and Orchestra in C – featuring FanHiu-sing and Jeremy Hao on violin – and the grand “Jupiter” Symphony as centralpieces. The program also includes Raff’s Sinfonietta for winds and Weiner’sDivertimento No. 1 which incorporates the Hungarian style.	
	Program	Raff: Sinfonietta in F, Op. 188	Mozart:Concertone for Two Violins and Orchestra in C, KV190 (186e)	Mozart: Symphony No. 41 in C, K. 551,"Jupiter"	Weiner: Divertimento No. 1 in D, Op. 20
presenterorg: Musicus Society

title: Musicus Fest 2023—Louis Lortie and Musicus Soloists Hong Kong
progtime: The performance will run for about 1 hour and 30 minutes, including a 15 minute intermission.
desc:
Guest Artistic Director/ Piano Solo: LouisLortie	Violin Solo: Angela Chan	Musicus Soloists Hong Kong	
	Award-winningFrench-Canadian pianist Louis Lortie is one of the most versatile artistsworldwide, with a repertoire of astonishing breadth built up over a 40-yearcareer. He was winner of the prestigious Busoni Competition, laureate of theLeeds Competition and Master in Residence at the Queen Elisabeth Music Chapelof Brussels from 2017 to 2022.	
	In this special concert, Lortie guides theensemble to explore works by Nordic composers Carl Nielsen, Arvo Pärt and JeanSibelius, in addition to performing Grieg’s unparalleled Piano Concerto in Aminor in a rarely heard arrangement with all strings accompaniment by MSHK.	
	Program	Nielsen: Little Suite for Strings, Op. 1	Pärt: Fratres for Violin, Strings andPercussion	Sibelius: Romance in C for String Orchestra,Op. 42	Sibelius: Impromptu for String Orchestra,Op. 5	Grieg: Piano Concerto in A minor, Op. 16
presenterorg: Musicus Society

title: Musicus Fest 2023—Next Generation Virtuosi
progtime: The concert will run for about 1 hour and 30 minutes, including a 15 minute intermission.
desc:
Violin: Aaron Chan	Piano: Colleen Lee	
	“Singing tone…bravura technique and poeticimagination”	
	2023Young Artist Audition winner and two-time winner of the prestigious SylvaGelber Award, violinist Aaron Chan had also won concerto competitions at theCleveland Institute, McGill and Rice universities. Moreover, he has honed hisskills by taking part in the Verbier Festival’s Soloist and Chamber MusicAcademy in Switzerland.	
	Chan will be accompanied by renowned HongKong pianist and International Chopin Piano Competition prizewinner Colleen Leein romantic period works.	
	
	Program	Grieg: Violin Sonata No.3 in C minor, Op.45	Hubay: Carmen: Fantaisie brillante	Dubugnon: Retour á Montfort l'Amaury	Beethoven: Violin Sonata No. 5 in F, Op.24,"Spring"	Clara Schumann: Three Romances for Violinand Piano, Op. 22
presenterorg: Musicus Society

title: Musicus Fest 2023—Trey Lee and Camerata Salzburg
progtime: The performance will run for about 1 hour and 40 minutes, including a 20-minute intermission.
desc:
Cello: Trey Lee	Camerata Salzburg	
	CamerataSalzburg graces Musicus Fest 2023 with Musicus Artistic Director and cellistTrey Lee as soloist to serve up a concert experience not to be missed. Theresident orchestra of Salzburg’s Mozarteum Festival has appeared in prestigiousvenues such as the Lucerne Festival, BBC Proms, Edinburgh InternationalFestival and Carnegie Hall in New York.	
	Trey Lee was praised as “a marvellousprotagonist...a superb cellist” by the late great conductor Lorin Maazel. Inthe hands of Trey and the Camerata, Shostakovich's Cello Concerto No. 1 is atour de force of the rhythmic power and relentless drive of his music. Theexquisite program is complemented by sailing through rolling waves inMendelssohn’s Hebrides Overture and basking in Beethoven’s triumphant SymphonyNo. 7.	
	Program	Mendelssohn: The Hebrides Overture,Op. 26	Shostakovich: Cello Concerto No. 1 inE-flat, Op. 107	Beethoven: Symphony No. 7 in A, Op. 92
presenterorg: Musicus Society

title: New Vision Arts Festival 2023: Bach im Theater: "St. John Passion" by Patrick Chiu, Ivanhoe Lam, SingFest and lautten compagney BERLIN (Germany)
agelimit: Audiences below 6 will not be admitted
desc:
Upending both the biblical story and Bach's masterpiece

Fusing Baroque music and contemporary theatre, choral artist Patrick Chiu and choreographer Ivanhoe Lam audaciously recast J.S. Bach's voice types and dramatic figures, where choristers and soloists engage in movement and action, bestowing the crucifixion story and Bach's choral masterpiece with an entirely new character.

Performers from Hong Kong, Germany, Japan and the USA hailing from a variety of ethnicities and backgrounds — and dressed in everyday clothes — play the roles of Jesus Christ, Peter, Pontius Pilate and the Jewish people. No matter whether in musical treatment, movement and staging, this production peels off layers of history, catapulting Jesus Christ and Bach into the 21st century: When all humanity is interlinked through politics, economics and technology, can we afford to be a spectator? How can anyone bear to live with irrevocable, fatal mistakes? 

In the role of Jesus, Reginald Mobley is one of today's hottest countertenors, having been invited to perform at the coronation ceremony of Charles III and the BBC Proms this year. 

Breaking through conventional interpretations of Bach's music, a preview of this production at Thüringen Bachwochen in the composer's home country last year received rave reviews.
remark:
(1) 30% early bird discount from 18 August to 5 September 2023
(2) Latecomers will only be admitted at a suitable break
(3) Performed in German with Chinese and English surtitles
(4) Meet-the-artist session after 18 Nov performance

Weekend Package Booking Discount^ (from 8 September)
20% discount for each purchase of full-price tickets for any TWO or more stage programmes within the same package below:
- "Double Murder" and "The Once and Future"
- "Book of Mountains and Seas" and "In the Name of Hanjin"
- "INK" and/or "RAIN" and/or "The Old Man and His Sea"
- Bach im Theater: "St. John Passion" and "Oh, To Believe In Another World"

"New Vision Arts Festival 2023" Group Booking Discount^ (from 8 September)
10% discount for each purchase of 4-9 full-price tickets for stage programmes; 15% discount for 10-19 tickets; 20% discount for 20 or more tickets.

"New Vision Arts Festival 2023" Package Booking Discount^ (from 8 September)
10% discount on full-price tickets for each purchase of 2 different programmes; 15% discount for 3 different programmes; 20% discount for 4 or more different programmes.

Patrons can enjoy only one of the above discount schemes for each ticket purchased.

Programme information is subject to change. For concessionary ticket details for URBTIX events, please call the URBTIX hotline at 3166 1100.

^Not applicable to tickets for workshops, masterclasses and backstage / stage tours.

title: Special Programme: Evolving Hong Kong – Dialogue with Mr. C.Y. Leung
desc:
Professor Hon Bing-wah invited Mr. C.Y. Leung for a dialogue to exchange views on several important design projects and their social significance, as well as his visual design concepts and deep commitment to social service. Drawing upon Mr. Leung's extensive experience serving Hong Kong in various official capacities, they will discuss Hong Kong's social and cultural development and changes, and the opportunities that have emerged from the recent national development initiatives, and encourage young people to foster their love and passion for our Country and Hong Kong, as well as the world. 

Speakers: Professor Hon Bing-wah (Renowned designer and artist) and Mr. Leung Chun-ying (Chairman of the GX Foundation and Chairman of the School Board of Minxin Hong Kong School (Guangzhou Nansha) 

In association with “The Reflection: Art & Design of Hon Bing-wah" Exhibition
remark: No registration needed. Audiences will be admitted 15 minutes before the programme commences. Limited seats on a first-come, first-served basis.
presenterorg:
Presented by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department
Organised by the Hong Kong Heritage Museum
